intro: Eremanthus mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian eremanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Eremanthus mattogrossensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
